page.title: 14 Lower Trethake Farm
page.content: Lower Trethake is a farm built about 1910. It has eighty acres and eight fields of these are pasture land. They have 3 tractors, a potato harvester, a bailer, a potato planter, a hayturner and a potato elevator. They have 90 bullocks and 25 chickens. Trethake was a medieval manor, and in 1312 John Trethake was the M.P. for Liskeard. The cow shed was probably the private chapel. The old kitchen fireplace, with a cloam oven, is now inside a garden shed. On the farm are the remains of the old Caradon Copper Mine, which only lasted for about 15 years.
